intro: Fuirena umbellata var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf umbellate fuirena, is a herbaceous perennial native to specific regions of South America. It features slender, angular stems that often branch at the base, supporting a cluster of small, umbel-like inflorescences. The leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with five petals and a central stamen, typical of the Apiaceae family. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments.
